proc drawToScreen(screenNode: Node) {....raises: [BoxyError, GLerror, KeyError,
    PixieError, IOError, Exception], tags: [TimeEffect, ReadDirEffect,
    ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
proc freeze(node: Node; scaleFactor = 1.0'f32) {.
    ...raises: [PixieError, KeyError, IOError, Exception, BoxyError, GLerror],
    tags: [TimeEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect],
    forbids: [].}
Freezes a node. This is used to speed up rendering by caching the node as an image. It is not a good idea to freeze nodes that are animated or that are being edited. Source   Edit   
proc isSimpleImage(node: Node): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Checks if node is a simple image and can be drawn purely with GPU and not go through CPU rendering path to resize it. Source   Edit   
proc readGpuPixelsFromScreen(): pixie.Image {....raises: [PixieError, GLerror],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Reads the GPU pixels from the screen. Use for debugging and tests only. Source   Edit

    ...raises: [WindyError, GLerror, BoxyError, PixieError, Exception],
    tags: [ReadEnvEffect, TimeEffect, RootEffect], forbids: [].}
